alert.note: Alert for Alachua; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:26AM EDT until March 29 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jacksonville FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Santa Fe River Near Worthington Springs affecting Alachua and Union Counties. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Santa Fe River Near Worthington Springs. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 56.0 feet, The boat ramp and floating dock at Chastain-Seay Park in Worthington Springs begin to flood. At 58.0 feet, Picnic Areas and campsites at Chastain-Seay Park in Worthington Springs begin to flood. At 59.0 feet, Chastain-Seay Park in Worthington Springs is generally closed to the public as access roads within the park become flooded. At 60.0 feet, A driveway near Southwest 102nd Court in Union County begins to flood at this level. Flooding along the river continues to impact boat ramps, docks and campgrounds in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 58.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 59.2 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 59.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
